toc_entry.title: Perfect Texas
toc_entry.description: There’s no point in grousing about Texas’ minor shortcomings. Why not just roll up our sleeves and make it perfect once and for all?

toc_entry.title: The Deluxe Down-And-Dirty Goose Hunt
toc_entry.description: In which a group of society ladies samples the thrills and chills of an essentially masculine pastime.

toc_entry.title: In the Wings
toc_entry.description: Backstage at the Houston Ballet is a world of pastel shadows, brilliant spangles, and anxious waiting.

toc_entry.title: “I Beat Ben Barnes And John Connally In A Fair Fight”
toc_entry.description: When Bames-Connally Investments announced plans to build apartments in a South Austin neighborhood, the residents banded together to try to stop them. They won the battle but lost the war.

toc_entry.title: Barbed Wire
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: It spelled the end of the open range and the beginning of modem Texas.

toc_entry.title: At the Mercy Of the Court
toc_entry.description: What do drunks, prostitutes, lunatics, and elevators have in common? They're all part of the weird 24-hour-a-day world of the Dallas County courthouse.

toc_entry.title: End Of the Trail
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: A fresh interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: I-10 On Ice
toc_entry.subtitle: Weather
toc_entry.description: In five hours on icy roads the author covered 35 miles and discovered the perils of driving in a state that is unprepared for real winter.

toc_entry.title: Big Oil Paranoia
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Robert Sherrill’s Oil Follies of 1970-1980 leaves no detail unremarked in its effort to pin the blame on Big Oil; in Ronnie Dugger’s On Reagan the author is as unbending an ideologue as his subject is.

toc_entry.title: Mermaid Love
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Ron Howard’s Splash is a refreshing frolic; Broadway Danny Rose gives us the old soft shoe; And the Ship Sails On is out to sea; Reuben, Reuben is a dark but funny double-decker.

toc_entry.title: Who Needs Singers?
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical
toc_entry.description: In conductor’s opera, each of the vocalists becomes just one more instrument in the musical ensemble.

toc_entry.title: Back In the Mood
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: A definitive Smithsonian Recordings collection sets a new standard for big band anthologies; other big band recordings prove that swing remains vibrantly alive.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: The kindest and unkindest cuts of all.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Looking for the essence of Texas in Ei Paso, the soul of Dr. Red Duke in Houston, the secrets of status in Dallas, and a quirky West Texas empire in Balmorhea.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Seven Texas jewelers show their mettle.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Mesa gets an unwanted ally in its battle against Gulf; how to turn $100 million into $12 million; why 1984 is a good year for incumbents; the legal establishment takes aim at a controversial supreme court judge.
